title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2946/91 of 7 October 1991 on the defraying of certain costs relating to food aid for the people of the Soviet Union
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 2946/91  of 7 October 1991  on the defraying of certain costs relating to food aid for the people of the Soviet Union
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Where the products to be supplied in the framework of the invitations to tender opened pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 598/91 have not been taken over by the bodies designated by the Commission on the latest date laid down for each supply to  be made available, the additional storage costs shall be defrayed by the Community in accordance with the provisions of this Regulation.

1. Additional storage costs shall be paid in respect of the period running:
- from and including the day following the latest date by which the goods are to be made available as laid down in the invitation to tender for takeover by the body designated by the Commission;
- the actual date of takeover of the product.
2. The additional storage costs are hereby fixed at ECU 0,25/tonnes per day.
3. The amount fixed in paragraph 2 shall be concerted into national currency using the rate applicable on 19 September 1991 and published in the 'C' series of the Official Journal of the European Communities.

Additional storage operations shall be entered in the accounts each month by the intervention agencies of the Member States and shall be shown in expenditure on emergency aid for the people of the Soviet Union.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 1 September 1991. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 7 October 1991. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
